alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 8:04AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harnett and Cumberland Counties through 845 AM EST... At 803 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Fayetteville to near Bladen Community College. Movement was north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lillington, Fort Bragg, Dunn, Angier, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake and Erwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for central North Carolina.
